DOC.brief_summary: Methods of infertility treatment may involve in vitro fertilization or IVF. Though effective, IVF is complex and expensive. Methods using no gonadotropin hormone stimulation of the ovaries are being compared to mild stimulation doses. The goal of the research is to determine which of these if more suitable as a low cost approach for varying individual patients.
DOC.brief_title: In Vitro Maturation With in Vitro Fertilization (IVF) Compared to Mild in Vitro Fertilization
DOC.detailed_description: Low cost environment is utilized, but fees are charged.
DOC.criteria: Under age 42 female, normal uterine cavity, BMI 1834kg/m2, Donor eggs, donor sperm, myoma over 5 cm Current hydrosalpinx, abnormal uterine cavity.
